content.description: The left arete of the steeper slab face on the Nubbin. Climb up from as low as you can on decent features just past the corner.
content.location: On the downhill side of the Nubbin.

climbs.name: My face is to pretty for slab

content.description: Easy standing start followed by a balancey middle to a satisfying top out
content.protection: Crash pad. Having a spotter might be a good idea might be a good idea due to the landing area.
content.location: The problem is on the left face if The Nubbin closest to the Arete.

content.description: Short but nice. Sit start matched on the corner, move up and left, and use some high feet to top out. With a few exceptions, the holds are unusually rounded for the area, and very solid.
content.protection: Pad. The landing is sloped, so careful how you place it.
content.location: Around on the right side of Crocodile Rock and a few feet up the hill.

content.description: Sit start with a funky pull on. Head up using the crack feature on the right. Gets a little burly at the top. The sit start is easy V3-ish, the stand start is something like V2 depending on wingspan. 2.5 stars if I could give it; it's a bit short for a full 3.
content.protection: Pad, maybe a spotter for the top.
content.location: On the side of the Nubbin facing you on approach. Starts middle of the face.

content.description: Captain Obvious is a standing start moves straight up and tops out tears the back of the boulder.
content.location: Far left of the left face of The Nubbin.

content.description: Sit start with matched hands on the nose crack. Top out using the pockets just to the left.
Sit start far right in the crack in the nose traverse left top out using the finger crack in the middle of the boulder.
Sit start low on the crocodile's mouth and traverse left tops our the same as Brain Drain.

content.location: Left most problem on Crocodile Rock.

content.description: Just below the Thurmond slab you'll find Crocodile Rock and just to the left is The Nubbin.  Crocodile Rock is a chossey overhanging boulder with several direct problems as well as a short and long traverse.     Just to the right and down the hill a little you'll find The Nubbin.  This boulder has two easy slab problems on the side facing Crocodile Rock, there's a definite hard problem following he arete, and a hard face problem on the right face.
